issues.description: The problem statement contains a contradiction about the return type of getNameAndTotalNumberOfStudents(): the textual task description (lines 43–45 of the problem statement) explicitly says the method should return a String with format "LectureName (TotalNumberOfStudents)", but the UML in the same problem statement (line 71) declares getNameAndTotalNumberOfStudents(): void. The solution implements the method as returning String. This inconsistency in the problem statement (text vs UML) can confuse students about what signature to implement and may cause them to implement the wrong return type, preventing tests from passing.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the specification consistent: update the UML in the problem statement so getNameAndTotalNumberOfStudents() is declared to return String (i.e., +getNameAndTotalNumberOfStudents(): String), matching the textual description and the solution. Alternatively, if the intended design was to return void, update the textual task description and the solution accordingly. Preferably align UML with the textual description (return String) so students implement the method signature correctly.
